Fields.DialogueText: Thanks for the tour of the ship. Anything else to show me, Chiyoda?
Īe. I hope that you're pleased with the ship, small though it may be, Kanchou.
We're exactly as large as we need to be. I'm looking forward to commanding this vessel.
Wonderful, then. I am yours to command. Do you have any further questions?
What can you tell me about yourself?
Kanchou, I'm not sure that I understand. Would you like me to give you the tour once more?

Fields.MenuText: No, I'd like to learn more about you as a person.
I'd like to know anything more that you'd personally like to tell me.
Yes, please.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou, the matter of whether I am, in fact, a person is still up for debate. Did you perhaps mean my personality?
There's nothing I can think of. Unless you're referring to my more superficial aspects, such as hobbies or personality.
Again? Kanchou, my apologies, but I can't help but wonder if you weren't being entirely genuine. Did you mean to tell a joke or be otherwise humorous?
Yes, that's precisely what I meant.
I would normally love to humor you, Kanchou, but I'm perceiving Funayūrei approaching us.
Would it be all right for us to continue talking later?
Of course. After we attend to our visitors.
@BATTLE
Chiyoda? Are you here in the engine room?
Ah! Hai, Kanchou?
I had some questions regarding the placement of some of the equipment back here, but it's taken me an hour to find you.
Oh my... did you attempt to contact me over the radio system?
Twice, now. I was also under the impression that you should simply be able to hear me from anywhere onboard. No?
Ah! Gomennasai! I was too caught up in my work!

Fields.MenuText: Relax. In future, just make sure someone on the bridge knows if you have a demanding project going.
I appreciate it. I'll try not to monopolize your time, but I need to be able to reach you in an emergency.
Don't be overwhelmed. You're fine.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai! I hope you don't think of me as being lax in my duties now.
Hai! It was not my intention to appear as though my head was in the clouds.
I... I won't be. I'm just worried that you will now find me to be lazy or, perhaps, apathetic. I'm anything but that!
That was not my impression at all. I'm just glad I found you in time. Morganas are approaching. We can discuss the engine room after.
Hai!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, I promise, this will never happen again!
Kanchou? Are you here? I apologize if I am interrupting.
Don't worry about interrupting me. I'm just reviewing some routine message traffic. What's on your mind?
Oh, well, in order to avoid a repeat of my disappearance yesterday...
You shouldn't worry so much about it. The matter is forgiven and forgotten.
I'm informing you that for the next few hours, I can be found on the bridge.
Doing what?
I'm sorry?
What is it that I might find you doing?
Drills.
What kind of drills?
Drills, Kanchou. Important ones. Oh! I lost track of time!
I'm late for my drills! Oh no! My drills!

Fields.MenuText: Enjoy your drills. Just make sure the crew eventually gets some rest.
Could you at least tell me what kinds of drills these are?
Chiyoda, wait a moment, please.

Fields.DialogueText: Of course, Kanchou.
Pardon my haste, but I must hurry. I will debrief you when I return!
No time, Kanchou!
And... she's gone. That was quick.
*ALARM*
Sounds like training is cancelled anyway...
@BATTLE
AH! Kanchou? Is that you at my cabin door? H-hello!
My apologies for startling you. Again.
No harm was done. I did not have my brush on the canvas when I jumped.
I'm not sure which of us is more surprised, Chiyoda. Are you really painting?
Yes. I am. Sumimasen.
What are you apologizing for? It's excellent work. A seagull, yes?
Hai! It is. I am pleased that you like it... but I promise I will try to be more alert today.

Fields.MenuText: Why? This ship's in no danger at the moment.
A little more attentiveness couldn't hurt, but feel free to keep painting.
If only to avoid being so startled. I'm not a Morgana knocking on your door.

Fields.DialogueText: Actually, it appears we're being attacked by Funayūrei right now.
Actually, it appears we're being attacked by Funayūrei right now.
Actually, it appears we're being attacked by Funayūrei right now.
Of course we are. I'll meet you on the bridge.
Gomennasai! This won't happen again!
Huh? What won't happen again?
Frivolous actions such as painting, golf, or other activities that have the propensity to distract from one's-
We can talk about this later. For now, to arms!
Understood!
@BATTLE
Kanchou...
That was fine work, Chiyoda. You should be proud.
Arigatō gozaimasu!
You're continually taking responsibility for problems that haven't occurred. Why are you so nervous regarding your hobbies?
Oh. Well, Kanchou, I'm relatively young. I'm still making my first impressions. I am concerned that you may disapprove of my frivolous activities.
I'm your captain, but I'm not a grouch. As our Kami, you do know we have a recreation room for exactly such activities.
But that room is for the crew, Kanchou. As Kami, I'm held up to different standards. I can't afford to slip up for even a moment.
Standards no different than mine. I find no issue in your hobbies.
Oh...
Even if I engage them during Morgana attacks? Attacks resembling, perhaps, the one about to occur.
You sense them? Now?
Hai.
Kanchou, is there a reason I keep noticing these before you?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe I'm the inattentive one here.
It seems your hobbies aren't as distracting as you've made them out to be.
You didn't. There was just... something in my eye.

Fields.DialogueText: I hardly believe that's the case. How could you have become a Kanchou otherwise?
Perhaps, but I shouldn't I aspire to be as observant as I possibly can?
What on earth could be in your eye? Perhaps seawater? Or dust? After the combat we should dust the ship.
Perhaps we should focus on the matter at hand.
Yes! Hai! To battlestations, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
You said you had something else we needed to discuss?
Painting again, I see. How is this piece coming along?
AH! Kanchou!
Will it startle you every single time I say hello?
Gomennasai!
And stop apologizing for being startled! Please.
H- hai.
Perhaps I have overestimated the danger of harmless activities like golfing and my artistic pursuits.
I'm glad to hear you say that. What is this you're painting?
Another gull. Unfortunately, it's difficult to see much on the open sea besides gulls and the occasional whale.
We do have plenty of living subjects on board. Ever considered painting a member of the crew?
Oh! Do you think that they would mind?

Fields.MenuText: No, not at all! I believe some of the crew would enjoy the idea.
They're allowed to mind all they like. If they do, ask someone else.
Actually, I think some would mind quite a bit... but perhaps I could curb their reactions.

Fields.DialogueText: If you think so, Kanchou, it would certainly be an interesting challenge.
Oh! Understood, Kanchou!
If you're willing to antagonize the crew for my own personal endeavors, then I'd like to start soon... if only for both of our amusements.
That's the right idea. Now, I've caught word of an approaching Morgana. Get ready.
Aye aye, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
I've considered what you said earlier, regarding my hobbies.
Kanchou!
Yes, Chiyoda, what is it?
I painted one of the crew members, like you said! It was fun!
Who was it?
Private Nakashima, Kanchou!
And did they mind?
Yes! Very much so.

Fields.MenuText: Well, I'll have to see to it that Private Nakashima shows you some more respect in the future.
Direct any complaints to me then, Chiyoda.
Remember how I said you might find someone else to paint in that situation?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry yourself too much about it. There was no direct confrontation.
I'll do that, Kanchou!
Gomennasai, Kanchou... but Private Nakashima was just such an interesting subject! And he didn't express his displeasure until I had nearly finished.
We'll deal with that issue another time, then. May I see your painting?
No, Kanchou, I threw it overboard.
What?!
It wasn't good. I'll be starting my next one soon.
If they come so easily to you, then I'd like to see you start again after our next skirmish. Morganas off the port bow.
Hai! I was just about to mention that when our conversation permitted such things.
@BATTLE
What a meal! The food was fantastic. What was that dessert you were eating?
Hm? Oh. That was karumeyaki.
The crew seemed impressed.
I suppose so.
Chiyoda, you seem distracted. Is something the matter?
Perhaps. I'm very much like that chef.
Would you care to explain how?
Well, our chef doesn't really do any fighting, does he?
No, that's not his job. He's here to make food.
Do you think he'll be remembered for his service?

Fields.MenuText: Frankly, I don't think any of us will be remembered.
Every man and woman aboard deserve to be remembered. All contributions matter.
I will take care to make sure that we're all remembered.

Fields.DialogueText: If we will be forgotten, then how are we expected to bring honor to our cause? Are we all simply essential services?
Is being needed enough? Is there more he must do than simply cook?
And if something happens to you? Should the chef not be taking more precautions for his legacy?
What is this really about, Chiyoda?
I worry that I should be playing a more offensive role in this war, Kanchou. If I am not fighting like other kami do, not being in the fray...
Perhaps I am wasting away here.
Chiyoda, you mustn't compare yourself to our offensive ships. We all have an important duty to-
*ALARM*
That's the siren. We have visitors. Chiyoda, I need you at your best right now. All of us do.
Hai.
@BATTLE
Will we ever get some rest?! More Funayūrei on the horizon, Kanchou!
@BATTLE
Excellent work, Chiyoda. I appreciate your focus in combat.
Arigatō. You're very kind, Kanchou.
I'm learning to translate that look. You've got something on your mind. Care to continue talking, Chiyoda?
I've heard the rhetoric before. "We're all necessary. By being supportive, we're necessary." I'm just not sure I believe it.
What's not to believe? If we lost our chefs, we'd have no food. Subsequently, we'd starve. How is that not essential?
But shouldn't a ship strive to be more? Shouldn't I be exhibiting bravery? Shouldn't I be more than a seaplane tender?

Fields.MenuText: Bravery is not the only measure of a person's worth.
You've seen more combat than many destroyers, you know. I don't know how else to prove that we need you.
I don't know where you picked up this notion that a seaplane tender is somehow less glamorous or necessary than any other ship we have.

Fields.DialogueText: But isn't it needed at the most important times? If I'm not useful when I'm needed most, then shouldn't I try and fix that?
But what have I accomplished? Other Kami are out there right now on the front lines protecting all of humanity with their lives! Shouldn't I do the same?
I don't believe that I'm less necessary, but it's my duty to the Empire to be more than what I currently am.
I don't know what to tell you, Chiyoda. Your existence as a seaplane tender is vital.
Perhaps the time will come soon where you are able to prove yourself above and beyond the call of duty. What do you say?
I'll be waiting for that day.
We both will.
Golfing now, I see.
Oh! Hai.
You have a fine swing. I'm not sure if that last ball you hit is ever going to land.
It already did, Kanchou.
I was kidding, Chiyoda. I saw it too.
Oh. Sumimasen.
Let me guess. You're still feeling down about being "just a seaplane tender," right?
In the last battle, some of the Kami exhibited incredible bravery.
And some were also injured quite badly.
I don't fear injury, Kanchou. I fear that my time will pass and I will have been expendable.

Fields.MenuText: Everyone is expendable, Chiyoda. If Kongou or any other ship sinks, we must continue.
We do everything in our power to make sure our soldiers and ships are remembered. You've seen our efforts.
I don't believe you've done a single thing on these oceans that wasn't important. Paintings included.

Fields.DialogueText: I don't expect you to get over this right away, Chiyoda. I sometimes have the same thoughts myself. Can I still count on you giving us your all?
Of course, Kanchou.
Excellent. HQ has reported that a Morgana force is approaching our position. Give us your all right, and give history a chance to remember you.
I... I will. Arigatō.
@BATTLE
After-action reports, Captain, submitted for your review – as ordered.
Thank you, Lieutenant. Good work on these.
Actually, I noticed her running towards the engine room just before I got here.
Running? That's odd.
For what it's worth, I didn't smell anything burning...
Glad to hear it. Dismissed.
*A Few Minutes Later*
Chiyoda? Are you here?
I... I am. I'm back here. Gomennasai!
I thought we were past the startling and the apologies. What's wrong, Chiyoda?
It was one of the Funayūrei we fought - "Delusion" is her name. During the combat, she was... staring at me.
She really had it in for us, yes.
No, she was staring at me. I saw her charge a couple of times and I... I just... froze. I'm so sorry, Kanchou. I was so frightened.

Fields.MenuText: If you were frightened, I didn't see it. I don't believe anyone else did either. You displayed fine bravery out there.
What matters is how you fought, and you did great. I don't have any regrets about your performance.
I was frightened too. Delusion is extremely scary, don't hold it against yourself.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm... very happy to have made you proud, Kanchou.
I don't either. I was just scared. Thank you, Kanchou.
You weren't scared! I saw you!
Chiyoda, are you going to be all right?
I believe so. Arigatōgozaimasu.
Of course. Get back to your station, Chiyoda. I'm certain another Morgana force will be engaging us soon.
I'll be right there!
@BATTLE
Say, have you seen Chiyoda anywhere?
No time to rest, Kanchou! I've detected incoming enemy forces!
All hands to battlestations!
@BATTLE
Another painting, Chiyoda? I hope I'm not interrupting a new masterpiece.
I welcome your arrival, Kanchou. I've just finished my picture of Lieutenant Kamiya. I had not realized how much he fidgets when he attempts to be still.
Heh. Even the most stoic officers have their quirks.
Are you starting another painting soon, or would you like to do something else? I thought maybe we could hit a few golf balls off of the deck.
No, that's quite all right.
Okay. What's the matter?
I'm still scared. Even after the last battle. I can't get Delusion's eyes out of my head. It's as if she burned her image into my mind.
How am I supposed to stand up to this kind of enemy? Throughout the battle, she was watching me. Had I angered her? Or perhaps she was taunting me...

Fields.MenuText: Didn't you tell me that you wanted to be on the front lines? Face-to-face with our enemies?
Morganas are strange creatures, but don't let them intimidate you.
We've done nothing to anger them except to simply exist. She's not coming for you, she's coming for all of us.

Fields.DialogueText: I did. And I do. But I suspect I will never be able to stand up to something like her.
It's not a matter of letting them. This must be some sort of unnatural power.
But why would she single me out? What did I do to deserve her wrath more than any other ship? This makes no sense...
I haven't been at peace since I saw her.
You need to relax. Are you sure a few rounds of golf would help? Or maybe a cup of tea?
I am positive. It's too late for tea, anyway. Please pardon me, Kanchou.
Nice swing! I could watch you tee off a hundred times and still be amazed, Chiyoda.
Arigatō! I feel as though I'm growing more skilled every day.
You seem to be in much higher spirits. May I ask what's changed?
I refocused my mind off of that battle with Delusion, and I'm ready to go back to enjoying the warm sun and the sight of golf balls disappearing into the distance.
Really? That's... well, that's great, Chiyoda!
You sure you don't prefer me sullen?

Fields.MenuText: Not at all!
Of course not. I'm just curious about the cause for your drastic change in your spirits.
I'd prefer you to be happy, if your happiness is genuine.

Fields.DialogueText: It pleases me, too.
Why waste time being sad if the urge to be happy overcomes me?
It is genuine, Kanchou, and I certainly appreciate the concern. I'm perfectly fine.
Now, I hate to cut the merriment short, but...
Oh! I see them, too. Funayūrei off the starboard bow. I'll begin alerting the crew!
Great, Chiyoda. Promise me you're going to be okay?
Yes, Kanchou. Yakusoku shimasu.
Then get the crew to their stations. We don't have much time before the shooting starts!
@BATTLE
Kanchou, would you do me the honor of looking at my latest painting?
The honor would be mine, Chiyoda.
Recognize this crew member? I hope I've captured Commander Otomo's likeness.

Fields.MenuText: Perfection! You could place this in Commander Otomo's living quarters and she'd mistake it for a mirror.
Your skills are coming along nicely. You've got unlimited potential as a painter!
Commander Otomo? I suppose it could be... from a distance... a long distance...

Fields.DialogueText: I can't help but feel as though you're flattering me unnecessarily, Kanchou... but thank you!
You think so? I am pleased that you like it.
Oh. I'll admit some disappointment, but I will work harder on my next painting.
Have you showed this to her?
Not yet, but this painting is not really for her. It's for me. It brings me peace.
Peace? You find Commander Otomo peaceful? A bit odd...
No, Kanchou The painting brings me peace of mind, knowing that I can leave behind more than just wreckage.
What exactly are you talking about, Chiyoda? Has something happened that you're not telling me?
Nothing at all, Kanchou. I'm just happy to know that something I create will survive my eventual defeat.
I hope you realize that I fully intend for you to survive this war. And well beyond, for that matter.
Of course you do, Kanchou. And intentions are important.
... I don't even know what to say to that.
*ALARM*
Hopefully not too much to say. We have incoming enemies to resolve, after all!
Right! Right. To arms, then.
@BATTLE
Another battle so soon? I am not certain I am ready...
No choice, Chiyoda. Get ready to fight.
@BATTLE
Was that it? Oh! Is it ending so soon? I... I...
Relax, Chiyoda. Combat's over, and we're securing from battlestations.
I did not mean the end to the combat, Kanchou. I meant... my end. Oh... I'm not ready to die yet... I...
Chiyoda? Are you all right?
Lieutenant! Did we sustain cataclysmic damage?
We're absolutely not going to sink, Captain. Repairs are in progress.
I thought so. Give us a minute, please.
Yes, Captain.
You're fine, Chiyoda. I'm here, and I promise you are not sinking today.
Kanchou? Oh... arigatō. I am not quite certain what just happened...

Fields.MenuText: I should contact the Protection Force. You might need some time in port.
You need to confide in me when you are feeling overwhelmed. It's the only way out of this.
Steel your nerves and act like a warship. I can't have you panicking again, it's dangerous.

Fields.DialogueText: Return me to port? No! I... I just need a minute or two, and I will be fine.
I will do that. It's hard, but I will. I promise you that I will open up.
I can and I will, Kanchou. This is under control. Yakusoku shimasu.
Then I need you to remain calm. Can you stay calm for me?
Hai. I can stay calm.
If you promise. Chiyoda. This really needs to be behind us.
I understand.
Kanchou! The glassy waves beckon like the hills of a blue-green fairway. Care to join me for some golf?
You seem to be in high spirits. Not letting recent events get to you, huh?
No, Kanchou.
Just like last time.
Hai.
And you're okay, then?
Hai.

Fields.MenuText: I'm skeptical. You must understand, considering what happened before.
Fantastic news, Chiyoda!
Are you crazy enough to think I'd believe that?

Fields.DialogueText: I do, Kanchou. However, I have decided to rid my mind of such unpleasantness completely. That is exactly what I'm doing.
Why, thank you! It was a simple matter of pushing such unpleasantness entirely out of my mind.
What's not to believe? I've simply pushed the matter out of my head completely, where it can be ignored.
You're just... bottling it up, then? Chiyoda, I don't think that-
I prefer to think of it as setting it aside.
Did you know that Emperor Hirohito and I share a love of golf?
It's not why I love golf, not at all. The sport does seem more... regal as a consequence, however.
I'd imagine so....
Upon becoming the first royal prince to leave Japan, he played golf and visited museums and even bet on horse races!
He's quoted as stating to his brother afterward, "I discovered freedom for the first time in England." Isn't that fascinating?
Yes. Fascinating. Right. That's exactly what I was thinking.
Oh! Kanchou! Funayūrei approaching from astern!
Let's get to it, then.
@BATTLE
Kanchou? Pardon my intrusion, but I must ask a favor of you.
No intrusion at all, Chiyoda. You rescued me from reviewing logistics paperwork. What's the favor?
Kanchou, are you familiar with John Audubon's 'Birds of America?'
The book of prints, right? If I'm thinking of the right thing, yes - it's actually quite famous.
Hai! I've been inspired by his works for a long time. I'd hoped to create a collection of paintings in a similar fashion.
I believe I may finally have a large enough collection of paintings of our crew members to do so. To publish a book, I mean.
That's wonderful, Chiyoda! What's the favor, though? What do you need?
I require your help. It had occurred to me that a few crew members might be displeased to have their likeness appear in such a book.
Like?
Commander Nakashima for one.

Fields.MenuText: He'll answer to me, then, don't let it stop you.
Perhaps ask Commander Nakashima first. Otherwise I think you're fine.
Just leave Commander Nakashima out of such a book, then.

Fields.DialogueText: Arigato, Kanchou! It means so much to have your support in this endeavor.
I despise speaking to Commander Nakashima... but I will. Thank you, Kanchou.
Oh well, shikata ga nai... but I think it will be a fine collection, regardless. Thank you, Kanchou.
What do you plan to name this collection?
Something simple. Perhaps "A Collection of Painted Images of the Crew in Service Aboard the Imperial Seaplane Tender Chiyoda" or a similar title.
Uh-huh. Simple... How about "Chiyoda's Crew?"
I don't wish to imply I own these men and women, Kanchou.
But this is my crew just as it is yours. I think it would be a lovely title. It has a nice ring to it.
A ring?
You know, it sounds nice and catchy.
I see!
*ALARM*
Chiyoda, it appears that some visitors have arrived! Ready?
I don't suppose they would wait on me if I said no?
Good point.
@BATTLE
I've been meaning to compliment your performance, Chiyoda. We're growing stronger and more effective with each battle.
Dōmo arigatō!
Clever timing... but you've earned it. What's the favor?
I'd just... really like to know... and if this isn't acceptable, of course, I would completely understand...
You can spit it out, Chiyoda, I'm sure it's not so bad.
My collection of crew paintings will never be complete without one thing. One person in particular.
Ah. I was wondering when this was going to happen.
Would you mind posing for a portrait? It's the last painting I'd like to add to my collection, and I'm hoping it will be my best work.

Fields.MenuText: I'd be thrilled, Chiyoda.
Only if you add a self-portrait as well.
I'm not so sure...

Fields.DialogueText: YATTA!
I suppose it could be appropriate for the artist to do such a thing. I am the ship's Kami, after all.
Please! It would mean the world to me!
I do have a body-length mirror in my quarters if you'd like to use it.
Any chance you'd be available to pose right now?
I'll have to think about it...
I'll take that as a yes!
And... if you are pleased, perhaps this is a good time for me to ask you for another favor?
YATTA!
Kanchou, I'm sorry to interrupt you, but...
We have incoming?
We do.
@BATTLE
Is my regular uniform okay?
Hai. I would just ask that you stay still.
I should have trusted my instincts before... I'll go change into a different suit.
Kanchou! You look wonderful! If you stay still for only a few more moments, I can finish the rest on my own!
Chiyoda, I'm not sure I've ever seen you this demanding. You're actually gentler when giving out orders during armed conflict.
Talking doesn't count as being still!
*ALARM*
The siren's going off.
Indeed it is - please hold still.
Chiyoda...
Ten more seconds!

Fields.MenuText: Okay, I'll be quiet.
Chiyoda, we're in trouble...

Fields.DialogueText: Shh!
Quiet! Five more seconds!
Chiyoda...
CHIYODA! FOR THE LOVE OF-
Got it! I can finish the rest myself! Battlestations!
@BATTLE
Chiyoda, it's... grand. It's absolutely stunning. You've made me far better looking than I am in reality.
Kanchou, you have the situation backwards. You are the one who flatters me.
I don't even know what to say, looking at this. It's exquisite, Chiyoda.
Dōmo arigatō gozaimasu!
So, is this the last painting for "Chiyoda's Crew?"
I've not decided on a title yet.
But is this the last one?
Hai. I would like to get back to painting wildlife.
Fish and birds again, huh?
What can I say? Painting seagulls over and over again does seem to have its charms.
Well, I can't thank you enough for your painting, Chiyoda.
I'm honored, Kanchou... but you realize I'm not giving the painting to you, right?

Fields.MenuText: You're not? Oh. Well, this is embarrassing...
Are you absolutely positive, Chiyoda?
I'm grateful simply for the honor of being painted by you.

Fields.DialogueText: Kanchou! You must have known, I'm putting it in my collection!
It's going in my collection, Kanchou, you know that!
I'm pleased. I'm not keeping it myself either, I'm going to see if I can find a publisher.
Yes, yes, I know.
Oh! I sense Funayūrei approaching!
It appears our daily Morgana is right on time. You're not going to force me to sit still until they come this time, are you?
Negative, Kanchou. To arms!
@BATTLE
Why are we out here on the weather decks, Kanchou? It's so very cold...
We've received word of Morgana movements through this area. We need to detect them quickly.
And why does that require us to be outside?
The lookouts need all of the help they can get. Two extra pairs of eyes couldn't hurt.
*sigh*
You're far from a malcontent, Chiyoda, but hearing you complain is unusual. You don't seem to be yourself.
Kanchou, should something happen to me before our next shore leave, how would I ensure the return of my paintings to the mainland?
Ah. Worrying about your legacy again... Unless you're comfortable with a mail carrier-
I'm not. There's no way to ensure the safety of my paintings. Such is life on the sea, but I want them to reach the mainland very badly.
Kanchou, would it be wrong of me to ask you a favor?
It wouldn't be your first time.
In the event of a disaster... should you still live... will you try your best to get my paintings safely to shore?

Fields.MenuText: I can't promise you that I'd succeed, but I can promise I'll try.
Do you genuinely trust my hands in the face of certain danger, over those of a mail carrier?
A captain is supposed to go down with the ship, right?

Fields.DialogueText: A promise to try would satisfy me.
I do. The mail carrier would treat them as a package. You would treat them as dearly as I value them.
I would prefer that these paintings make it home and that you continue your life, Kanchou.
Then I promise you I will try my very best, Chiyoda.
Totemo ureshīdesu. It means a lot to me.
Then the matter is settled. Now get your binoculars up and help me scan for contacts, please.
I can sense them without the binoculars, Kanchou. Look there, at the horizon off the port beam.
I see them! Good eye, Chiyoda...
@BATTLE
I'm short on sleep, Chiyoda. That last battle went on longer than I would have liked.
I regret that I must bring an important matter to your attention, regardless.
What is it? Damage? A problem with the crew? Trouble sleeping?
Not particularly.
Not particularly well or you didn't sleep particularly poorly?
How, in a disaster, would you get to my paintings? How would you get them to shore?

Fields.MenuText: Uh... I'd put them in a lifeboat. Satisfied?
Er... I guess it depends on the circumstances of the disaster. I'm not sure what to tell you.
REALLY?! I'm trying to sleep, and you're waking me to ask how I'd save your paintings in a hypothetical disaster?!

Fields.DialogueText: I've made a mistake. I should not have disturbed you.
Did you know that I saw a seagull with an injured wing earlier today? It landed atop one of the recovery cranes.
Huh?
I painted it today, but I feared that perhaps I hurt it.
I don't think painting a bird can hurt it...
I mean, what if the wing was injured from one of my wayward golf balls?
I highly doubt that was your fault.
Hai. I do, too. Still, though. Wouldn't that be something? A tragedy no one could predict.
Chiyoda, whatever's going on in your head right now... paintings, seagulls... I think that-
Captain! Your attention is desperately needed! A large Funayūrei force spotted to the southwest, and Delusion may be amongst them.
So much for getting some rest. Chiyoda, let's go.
Hai.
@BATTLE
I know there have been sightings of Delusion in the area - do you know if she's with this group?
Sorry, ma'am. No idea.
Another wave of Funayūrei approaches, Kanchou. They give us no time to rest...
And we'll give them no mercy.
@BATTLE
Ahem! Chiyoda? I'm still waiting.
Regrets for the delay in making my reports, Kanchou, but I am all right.
Welcome back the ship.
Welcome back?
During that combat, you looked like you were a million miles away. What happened?
I saw Delusion in the distance, staring directly at me.
In the middle of all that chaos? Really?
I assure you, I felt her presence. She'll come with the next attack. They'll come for us again, once they have regrouped.
Are you certain? If you're so convinced, then we should ask for reinforcement. Inform the radio operator to contact HQ and request additional forces.
Hai. Help may not arrive in time to matter... but this is a prudent step, regardless.
You're much braver than you were before, Chiyoda. I need you to keep up this resilience.
Of course, Kanchou. To die for the Empire will be an honor.

Fields.MenuText: Yes, it will!
You're not dying on my watch, Chiyoda. I need all hands on deck, and that includes my Kami.
Let's not bet against ourselves, please.

Fields.DialogueText: Hai!
Hai!
Hai!
Do not mistake me, Kanchou. I am committed to fight for victory, no matter what.
Kanchou, she's approaching. Delusion is here in the third onslaught, the final attack, to kill me.
Chiyoda, I appreciate the weight of the situation, but don't let her get under your skin now.
Besides, she's not here to kill you.
She isn't?
No. She's here to kill everyone.
Ha! I do appreciate your attempt to lighten the mood with a joke. Kanchou. It's been an honor sailing with you.
Oh, and I've placed "Chiyoda's Crew" on the desk in your quarters. If those paintings make it to shore, I will have lived a full life.
Chiyoda...

Fields.MenuText: You have to stop talking like that. The crew needs us to be brave right now!
Delusion has you under a creepy spell. Snap out of it!
If you're right, then I pray that we will see each other again in the next world.

Fields.DialogueText: I will show them bravery, Kanchou. Bravery in the face of death.
Perhaps she is affecting me... that would explain so much... but I will fight fiercely just the same!
I am sure we will. Somewhere. Now, to arms!
@BATTLE
You're still breathing, Chiyoda. And floating.
Hai.
I told you.
I don't understand, Kanchou. I felt the call of duty. I felt my destiny embracing me. I saw the glint in Delusion's eyes. I could not have been surer.

Fields.MenuText: Tell me more about it.
I can relate, Chiyoda.
What you were feeling was false, Chiyoda. And irrational.

Fields.DialogueText: There are no other words, Kanchou.
I did not mean to imply otherwise. I should have realized this.
Perhaps...
My heart was beating out of my chest. I felt that it would happen suddenly, that gunfire would strike the deck, embedding itself in my heart.
Yet somehow, we're safe. My ship and my paintings survived. Why? Why did I feel that and why was I so certain, if it was all false?
You trusted a Morgana's word over mine.
I... I did. They're evil and deceptive.
And they've been wrong every time so far.
You're right, Kanchou. I can't believe I didn't see it. I was so foolish.
You would not be the first to believe them, Chiyoda. I'm just glad you survived to learn.
We depart for shore leave soon.
Totemo ureshīdesu. The opportunity to reflect upon what has happened will make me stronger. I feel... at peace. Please excuse me, Kanchou.
Hmmm...

Fields.MenuText: I'm glad I was able to help her figure things out.
What a resilient woman! I don't know what I'd do without her.
